description: Infinitary sociable numbers (smallest member of cycle).
comments: If n = product p_i^a_i, d = product p_i^c_i is an infinitary divisor of n if each c_i has a zero bit in its binary representation everywhere that the corresponding a_i does.
links: Graeme L. Cohen, On an integer's infinitary divisors, Math. Comp. 54 (189) (1990) 395-411.
J. O. M. Pedersen, Tables of Aliquot Cycles
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
